CONNECTIONS.connection_text: The longest-serving Texas governor grew up in Paint Creek, an experience he recalled in On My Honor, a book about his time as a Boy Scout.
Perry is a 1972 Texas A&M University graduate, was a member of the Corps and is possibly its most famous Yell Leader.

Perry began his career in state government as a member of the state House in 1985. He won statewide office in 1990, when he was elected agriculture commissioner. He became lieutenant governor in 1999. He succeed George W. Bush as governor in 2000 and made his first (unsuccessful) bid for the White House four years ago.

META.description: houston tktkt...second baptist...soliciter general...gwb camapign....private practice and currently lives in houston

CONNECTIONS.connection_text: The Republican U.S. senator grew up in Houston and graduated from Second Baptist High. He lives there now, and prior to his election to the Senate, he was a partner at the law firm Morgan, Lewis & Bockius.
As a domestic policy adviser on the Bush-Cheney 2000 presidential campaign, Cruz lived in the state's capital.
The former Florida governor was born into one of the best-connected Texas political families in this West Texas oil town in 1953.
Bush spent much of his early childhood in Houston. He later worked there in the late 1970s for Texas Commerce Bank.
Bush graduated from the University of Texas at Austin in the early 1970s.

CONNECTIONS.connection_text: One of Clinton's first political gigs was in Texas, working with her future husband on George McGovern’s 1972 presidential campaign. Based in Austin, she befriended GSD&M ad man Roy Spence and former Land Commissioner Garry Mauro – both worked on her 2008 presidential campaign. And she even managed to catch a Jerry Jeff Walker show.
Clinton told The New York Times in 2008 that she also spent part of her time during the McGovern campaign living in San Antonio and registering South Texas voters.

META.description: Paul spent most of his childhood in Lake Jackson and attended Baylor University. His father, Ron Paul, represented southeast Texas in non-consecutive terms from the 1970s until 2013.

CONNECTIONS.connection_text: The Kentucky senator grew up in southeast Texas, a region his father, former U.S. Rep. Ron Paul, represented on and off from the 1970s until his retirement in 2013.
Paul attended Baylor University in the early 1980s. He did not earn his bachelor's degree, but went on to Duke Medical School.

META.description: Born in Austin, Fiorina left the Lone Star State as a toddler. But she returned often, and recalls swimming in Barton Springs and visitng her grandparents in Calvert. Her family still owns property in the state. In 2010, she unsuccessfully ran for Senate in California.

CONNECTIONS.connection_text: Born in Austin, the former Hewlett-Packard CEO left the Lone Star State as a toddler. But she returned often, and recalls swimming in Barton Springs.
After her family's move, she visited her grandparents in the summers in Calvert. Her family still owns property in the state.

META.description: Long before he was governor of  Arkansas and or a Fox News Channel host, Huckabee attended the Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary located in Fort Worth between 1976-1977.

CONNECTIONS.connection_text: Long before he was governor of Arkansas or a Fox News host, Huckabee attended the Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary in Fort Worth between 1976 and 1977. He did not graduate.

META.description: The outgoing Maryland governor was the Dallas-based field director for Gary Hart's campagin for the 1984 Democratic nomination in 1984.

CONNECTIONS.connection_text: Maryland's outgoing Democratic governor was the Dallas-based field director for Gary Hart's campaign for the 1984 Democratic presidential nomination.

META.description: Warren, the senator from Massachusetts and a liberal favorite, earned her bachelor's at the University of Houston. She later taught there as a law professor, along with the University of Texas law school in the 1980s.

CONNECTIONS.connection_text: The Massachusetts senator, a Democrat, earned her B.S. at the University of Houston and later taught at the law school in the late 1970s and early 1980s.
Warren was a research associate and law professor at the University of Texas Law School from 1981 to 1987.

The former Pennsylvania senator, a Republican, is the CEO of a "family-friendly film company" called EchoLight Studios that is based in Flower Mound. His spokesman says he "spends a significant amount of time in the state through his obligations to the company." Also, Santorum's oldest daughter is a graduate of The University of Dallas.
The former Democratic Virginia senator's father was stationed in Texas four times over the course of his Air Force career. The younger Webb attended the sixth grade in Amarillo.
Webb's parents met in Monahans when his father was stationed there, and were married there in 1943.
The New Jersey governor, a Republican, was spotted in the owner's box cheering on the Cowboys and bear-hugging team owner Jerry Jones.
